definition: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
to beat/to flog/to examine under torture
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Many women accused of practicing witchcraft were tortured or even burned to death.
sentences.chinese: 許多女人被控行巫術，遭受拷打後被施以火刑。

sentences.english: They tortured the prisoner to death.
I will close the Guantanamo Bay prison and ban torture.
sentences.chinese: 我會關閉關塔那摩基地監獄，禁止刑訊拷打。

sentences.english: Shadow with the general belt XingShu apologise to see snow had been tortured.
sentences.chinese: 影佐將軍帶刑書媛來見已經被嚴刑拷打過的雪兒。

sentences.english: The subject of torture was depicted with a religious theme.
sentences.chinese: 嚴刑拷打被以一種宗教主題的形式描繪出來。

sentences.english: Facing too, the field of torture, JiDePing silence to die rather than give in.
sentences.chinese: 面對太田的嚴刑拷打，季德平沉默以對寧死不屈。

sentences.english: McCain spent five-and-a-half years in Vietnamese prison camps, where he was tortured and beaten.
sentences.chinese: 麥凱恩在越南戰俘營度過了5年半，飽受折磨拷打。

sentences.english: The soldiers endured many kinds of torture when they were in the hands of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 這些士兵在敵人的手中遭受了各樣的嚴刑拷打。

sentences.english: Havok took Princess Fel to the Chambers of Persuasion, where he tortured her.
sentences.chinese: 哈沃克將費爾公主帶到冥想室，在那裏拷打她。

sentences.english: During these tortures her breasts were cut off.
sentences.chinese: 他們折磨拷打她，把她的雙乳切了下來。
巴林一名博主被嚴刑拷打。

definition: strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
